actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to the order of Thursday, December 1, 2022,  the Journal of the proceedings of the Senate was deemed approved to date.
Pursuant to the order of Thursday, December 1, 2022, the morning hour being deemed expired, and the times for the recognition of the two leaders being reserved.
The following transactions of morning business occurred on today.

S.Res. 858 (Sen. Klobuchar):
        A resolution expressing support for the goals of National Adoption Day and National Adoption Month by promoting national awareness of adoption and the children awaiting families, celebrating children and families involved in adoption, and encouraging the people of the United States to secure safety, permanency, and well-being for all children.

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.

PN2192:
        Doris L. Pryor, of Indiana, to be United States Circuit Judge for the Seventh Circuit

        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 60 - 31. Record Vote Number: 373 



 PN2261:
        Dana M. Douglas, of Louisiana, to be United States Circuit Judge for the Fifth Circuit

        -- Motion to proceed to executive session to consideration of nomination agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

        -- Cloture motion presented in Senate.

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, mandatory quorum required under Rule XXII waived.


 PN2314:
        Frances Kay Behm, of Michigan, to be United States District Judge for the Eastern District of Michigan

        -- Considered by Senate.


 PN2315:
        Tamika R. Montgomery-Reeves, of Delaware, to be United States Circuit Judge for the Third Circuit

        -- Motion to proceed to executive session to consideration of nomination agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

        -- Cloture motion presented in Senate.

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, mandatory quorum required under Rule XXII waived.


 PN2438:
        Jeffery Paul Hopkins, of Ohio, to be United States District Judge for the Southern District of Ohio

        -- Motion to proceed to executive session to consideration of nomination agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

        -- Cloture motion presented in Senate.

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, mandatory quorum required under Rule XXII waived.
By unanimous consent, on the request of Ms. Cortez Masto, at  7:12 p.m., the Senate adjourned, under its order of today, until 10 a.m. tomorrow.
